How can I draw a figure in matplotlib where the axes are displayed within the plot itself, not on the side? I have tried the following code but it doesn't give me the desired output. 

```python
import math
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def sigmoid(x):
    a = []
    for item in x:
        a.append(1/(1+math.exp(-item)))
    return a

x = np.arange(-10., 10., 0.2)
sig = sigmoid(x)

plt.plot(x,sig)
plt.show()
```
This code displays the figure with the axes on the sides, but I want them in the middle, similar to the figure displayed in this Wikipedia image.

To place the axes in the middle of the plot, you can adjust the position of the spines in Matplotlib. Spines are the lines connecting the axis tick marks and noting the boundaries of the data area. You can set the position of these spines to 'zero' or any other position you desire. Here's how you can modify your code to achieve this effect:

```python
import math
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def sigmoid(x):
    return [1/(1+math.exp(-item)) for item in x]

x = np.arange(-10., 10., 0.2)
sig = sigmoid(x)

plt.plot(x, sig)

# Move left y-axis and bottom x-axis to the center, passing through (0,0)
plt.gca().spines['left'].set_position('zero')
plt.gca().spines['bottom'].set_position('zero')

# Eliminate upper and right spines
plt.gca().spines['right'].set_color('none')
plt.gca().spines['top'].set_color('none')

# Show ticks in the left and bottom spines only
plt.gca().xaxis.set_ticks_position('bottom')
plt.gca().yaxis.set_ticks_position('left')

plt.show()
```

This code will place the x-axis and y-axis in the center of the plot, creating a cross at the origin. Ticks will only appear on the bottom and left spines, and the right and top spines will be hidden. This will give you the desired effect similar to the image you mentioned.
